thread.title: Ground News - Proposed bill could result in withheld arts and culture funding if historic monuments are removed in Florida
thread.title_full: Ground News - Proposed bill could result in withheld arts and culture funding if historic monuments are removed in Florida

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Proposed bill could result in withheld arts and culture funding if historic monuments are removed in Florida
text:
Summary by Ground News The bill would allow for the governor to remove elected officials who take down monuments. The bill wouldn't force monuments that have already come down to go back up. Rep. Dean Black said changes to the bill are underway, but the basics will remain intact. A different bill filed earlier this year would also have prohibited certain actions concerning monuments. Share menu More

News 4 JAX Center High Factuality Media Conglomerate: Graham Holdings Proposed bill could result in withheld arts and culture funding if historic monuments are removed in Florida Although the monument dedicated to the women of the Confederacy in Jacksonville’s Springfield Park was removed Wednesday, the battle over Confederate monuments in Florida is far from over.A bill filed in Tallahassee last month would prohibit local governments from permanently removing historic monuments and memorials on public property. It would open up local officials who remove monuments to civil penalties and lawsuits, allowing plaintiffs to …
